inputs.name: Args
inputs.description: A string. Additional parameters to the command.

inputs.name: Config
inputs.description: A string. Name of config file specifying command line arguments.

inputs.name: Encoding direction
inputs.description: A list of items which are 'y' or 'x' or 'z' or 'x-' or 'y-' or 'z-'. Encoding direction for automatic generation of encoding_file.

inputs.name: Encoding file
inputs.description: An existing file name. Name of text file with pe directions/times.

inputs.name: Environ
inputs.description: A dictionary with keys which are a value of type 'str' and with values which are a value of type 'str'. Environment variables.

inputs.name: Estmov
inputs.description: 1 or 0. Estimate movements if set.

inputs.name: Fwhm
inputs.description: A float. Fwhm (in mm) of gaussian smoothing kernel.

inputs.name: Ignore exception
inputs.description: A boolean. Print an error message instead of throwing an exception in case the interface fails to run.

inputs.name: In file
inputs.description: An existing file name. Name of 4d file with images.

inputs.name: Interp
inputs.description: 'spline' or 'linear'. Image interpolation model, linear or spline.

inputs.name: Max iter
inputs.description: An integer (int or long). Max # of non-linear iterations.

inputs.name: Minmet
inputs.description: 0 or 1. Minimisation method 0=levenberg-marquardt, 1=scaled conjugate gradient.

inputs.name: Numprec
inputs.description: 'double' or 'float'. Precision for representing hessian, double or float.

inputs.name: Out base
inputs.description: A file name. Base-name of output files (spline coefficients (hz) and movement parameters).

inputs.name: Out corrected
inputs.description: A file name. Name of 4d image file with unwarped images.

inputs.name: Out field
inputs.description: A file name. Name of image file with field (hz).

inputs.name: Out logfile
inputs.description: A file name. Name of log-file.

inputs.name: Output type
inputs.description: 'nifti_pair' or 'nifti_pair_gz' or 'nifti_gz' or 'nifti'. Fsl output type.

inputs.name: Readout times
inputs.description: A list of items which are a float. Readout times (dwell times by # phase-encode steps minus 1).

inputs.name: Reg lambda
inputs.description: A float. Lambda weighting value of the regularisation term.

inputs.name: Regmod
inputs.description: 'bending_energy' or 'membrane_energy'. Regularisation term implementation. defaults to bending_energy. note that the two functions have vastly different scales. the membrane energy is based on the first derivatives and the bending energy on the second derivatives. the second derivatives will typically be much smaller than the first derivatives, so input lambda will have to be larger for bending_energy to yield approximately the same level of regularisation.

inputs.name: Regrid
inputs.description: 1 or 0. If set (=1), the calculations are done in a different grid.

inputs.name: Scale
inputs.description: 0 or 1. If set (=1), the images are individually scaled to a common mean.

inputs.name: Splineorder
inputs.description: An integer (int or long). Order of spline, 2->qadratic spline, 3->cubic spline.

inputs.name: Ssqlambda
inputs.description: 1 or 0. Weight lambda by the current value of the ssd. if used (=1), the effective weight of regularisation term becomes higher for the initial iterations, therefore initial steps are a little smoother than they would without weighting. this reduces the risk of finding a local minimum.

inputs.name: Subsamp
inputs.description: An integer (int or long). Sub-sampling scheme.

inputs.name: Terminal output
inputs.description: 'stream' or 'allatonce' or 'file' or 'none'. Control terminal output: `stream` - displays to terminal immediately (default), `allatonce` - waits till command is finished to display output, `file` - writes output to file, `none` - output is ignored.

inputs.name: Warp res
inputs.description: A float. (approximate) resolution (in mm) of warp basis for the different sub-sampling levels.

name: TOPUP
description: TOPUP, as implemented in Nipype (module: nipype.interfaces.fsl, interface: TOPUP).
